channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: In Britain, Child’s Weight Leads to Parents’ Arrest
item.description: The police called it a rare step when they arrested the parents of a 210-pound, 11-year-old boy on suspicion of neglect and child cruelty.
item.dc:creator: By KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA

item.title: Susan Rice Affirms View That P.O.W. Served With ‘Honor’
item.description: The national security adviser, Susan E. Rice, insisted that she had been right to assert that Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl served with “honor and distinction.”
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER

item.title: World Briefing: Austrian Journalist Convicted in Holocaust Restitution Case Vows to Appeal
item.description: Stephan Templ, accused of defrauding the state by omitting a relative from a restitution claim for property looted by the Nazis in 1939, was sentenced to one year in prison.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Obama and Putin Meet Briefly at D-Day Event
item.description: Presidents Obama and Putin spoke as did Mr. Putin and Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER

item.title: Survivor of Attack on Jewish Museum in Brussels Dies
item.description: The death of Alexandre Strens, 24, who was working as a receptionist at the museum at the time of the attack, raises the death toll to four.
item.dc:creator: By SCOTT SAYARE

item.title: State Department Ramps Up Efforts Against Boko Haram
item.description: State Department officials acknowledged that their efforts to directly challenge Boko Haram could prove challenging in a region racked by massacres, bombings and shootings.
item.dc:creator: By RON NIXON
item.media:description: A mother of one of the Nigerian girls kidnapped by the extremist group Boko Haram, during a news conference in Lagos on Friday.

item.title: Man Arrested in Rampage That Left 3 Canadian Officers Dead
item.description: The hunt for the suspect, Justin Bourque, accused of killing three Mounties and wounding two more, had paralyzed the city of Moncton, New Brunswick.
item.dc:creator: By IAN AUSTEN

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: June 6
item.description: Exiled Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama spoke to school and college students in Dharamsala, Himachal Pradesh.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: The Dalai Lama, exiled Tibetan spiritual leader, speaking on the final day of his annual teaching schedule for Tibetan school and college students in Dharamsala, Himachal Pradesh.

item.title: North Korea Detains Another American
item.description: The man, the third American being held in North Korea, was accused of unspecified illegal acts while visiting the country as a tourist.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: As Iran Gains Influence, Saudi Arabia Revisits Ties Built on Distrust
item.description: With the Persian Gulf region still in tumult, there have been surprising signs that Tehran and Riyadh are looking to temper their destructive rivalry.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD

item.title: How the Times Covered D-Day in the Paper of June 6, 1944
item.description: The language of the article that appeared in The New York Times about the D-Day invasion was simple, the events it described were anything but.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY
item.media:credit: Capt. Herman Wall/U.S. National Archives, via Reuters
item.media:description: American reinforcements landed on Omaha beach near Vierville-sur-Mer, France, on D-Day.

item.title: India Ink: Remembering Operation Bluestar on Its 30th Anniversary
item.description: A sampling of stories reflecting on the 30th anniversary of the Indian Army’s storming of the Golden Temple in an attempt to flush out militants.
item.dc:creator: By NIDA NAJAR
item.media:description: A Sikh devotee at the Golden Temple in Amritsar, Punjab, on June 1.

item.title: Pakistan Suspends License of Leading TV News Channel
item.description: The 15-day suspension of Geo is seen as a sign of growing tensions between the country’s civilian and military leaders.
item.dc:creator: By DECLAN WALSH

item.title: The World Cup Soundtrack
item.description: If you want to find the best funk music in Brazil, you’ll need to stray far from the stadiums.
item.dc:creator: By SIMON ROMERO
item.media:credit: Sebastián Liste/Reportage, for The New York Times
item.media:description: MC Tigrão, a funk singer, during a rooftop rehearsal in the favela Jacarezinho.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: The Once and Future Kings
item.description: Felipe will have to build a constituency among a Spanish public that has lost trust in all national institutions.
item.category: Juan Carlos I, King of Spain
item.dc:creator: By MIGUEL-ANXO MURADO

item.title: Leaders Gather to Honor D-Day Normandy Landing
item.description: The two leaders talked after initially appearing to ignore each other at a gathering in France to mark the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landing.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: France’s President Franςois Hollande, flanked by President Obama, Queen Elizabeth, Queen Margrethe II and Vladimir Putin, spoke during a lunch at Chateau de Benouville on Friday.

item.title: Leaders Gather to Honor D-Day Normandy Landing
item.description: The two leaders talked after initially appearing to ignore each others at a gathering in France to mark the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landing.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Fortify Flour to Help Babies
item.description: Why don’t European governments do for their own people what they encourage African governments to do for theirs?
item.dc:creator: By PATRICK ADAMS

item.title: China Will Deport Detained Artist, Australia Says
item.description: The artist, an Australian citizen born in China, was seized after publicizing images of a replica of Tiananmen Square he made out of ground pork.
item.dc:creator: By DAN LEVIN
item.media:description: Guo Jian, left, walked to a police car after he retrieved some personal belongings from his studio in Beijing on Friday. The Chinese-born Australian artist, who has been detained since June 1, will be deported.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: The People vs. The Monks
item.description: Never before have so many lay Buddhists in Myanmar pushed back against the monks.
item.dc:creator: By MIN ZIN

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: France’s Ticking Time Bomb
item.description: Politics has veered into tragicomedy, with Marine Le Pen’s National Front aiming for the Élysée.
item.dc:creator: By FRANÇOISE FRESSOZ
item.media:description: With her key political opponents in disarray, Marine Le Pen only has to reap the whirlwind.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: We Are the World (Cup)
item.description: Bringing the world together, one soccer match at a time.
item.dc:creator: By PAMELA DRUCKERMAN

item.title: Singing Nun Wins Italian TV Talent Show
item.description: Sister Cristina Scuccia became a viral sensation belting out pop hits, but some now wonder whether fame will lead her astray from her first calling.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Vietnam Says Video Shows Chinese Ship Intentionally Sinking Boat
item.description: Vietnam has released video of a clash at sea last month that it says shows a Chinese vessel in disputed waters intentionally ramming and sinking a smaller Vietnamese fishing boat.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: One More Senior Official Reportedly Kills Himself
item.description: The death by hanging of a deputy city mayor of Weifang has highlighted what appears to be a growing number of suicides by officials in China amid an anticorruption campaign.
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
